page.title: 04Government: Parish Council
page.content: {Twyning's Parish Council consists of nine members.{Meetings}are held once a month in the{Village Hall.}An {extraordinary meeting}can be called if there is something urgent to discuss. {Elections}are held every four years and everyone over the age of eighteen who lives in Twyning can vote. The{Parish Council}considers matters that are for the good of the {Parish}and can pass on information to the{Borough and County Councils.}It raises money by levying a small rate. An{annual general meeting}is held at which the{Chairman}and Vicechairman are appointed. Everything that is discussed at council meetings is recorded in a{minute book.}This is the duty of the{Clerk}who also attends to all correspondence and keeps a record of financial matters. These books are on view to the general public.
